headline: Trump-Endorsed Herschel Walker Wins Georgia Senate Primary
author: Rebecca Downs
sentences:
Source: AP Photo/Ben Gray
Less than an hour after the polls closed in Georgia on Tuesday night, former NFL player Herschel Walker, who was endorsed by former President Donald Trump, was declared the winner in the Republican primary by Decision Desk Headquarters.

First Votes In: GA Senate GOP (Thread)

(65%)

As of 8:13pm, Walker had 68.74 percent of the vote.

Reverend Raphael Warnock (@ReverendWarnock) May 3, 2022
The race is currently considered to be a "Toss-Up" by Cook Political Report, Sabato's Crystal Ball, and Inside Elections.

Race call: 7:38pm EDT
More results here: https://t.co/r3Sw6SmXle
 Decision Desk HQ (@DecisionDeskHQ) May 24, 2022
From the start, Walker looked to be leading in the returns.
As a pro-choice pastor, Ive always believed that a patient's room is way too small for a woman, her doctor, and the United States government.
Decision Desk HQ projects Herschel Walker (@HerschelWalker) is the winner of the Republican nomination for U.S. Senate in Georgia.
He has also refused to mention any abortion limit he would support, as is the case with many other pro-abortion Democrats.
He will go on to face Sen. Raphael Warnock, one of Georgia's two Democratic senators, in the November general election.
Every life is precious and created by God, and Georgians deserve a Senator who will always stand up for life.
The next closest contender, Georgia Commissioner of Agriculture Gary Black, had 14.37 percent of the vote.
As Madeline covered last week, Walker said "theres no exception in my mind" when it comes to abortion.
He was also endorsed by the National Right to Life Committee (NRLC) on April 19.
Walker recently gained attention in the news for his pro-life position.
I'll always fight to protect a woman's right to choose.
As a Christian and a father, I am proudly pro-life.
Reverend Warnock says he is a pro-choice pastor.
